subtitle: These sweetened rolls are great spread with butter whilst still warm.

method.text: Lightly butter a 17.5 - 20 cm round shallow dish or tin (check recommendations in your operating instructions), and line the base with a circle of baking parchment or greased greaseproof paper.
Place the flour, caster sugar, salt and yeast into a bowl and mix well together. Add the butter (or margarine), egg and water. Beat vigorously until smooth and a soft dough is formed.

Knead well. Cover. Allow to prove by leaving to rise in a warm place for about 45 min. Alternatively, to prove in the microwave, give the dough 3-4 min on 10% (very LOW), or 10-15 secs on 100% (FULL), and then leave to rest for 5-10 min. Repeat this process until the dough has doubled in size.
Knock back the dough and cut into 12 evenly sized pieces. Knead each piece and place into the prepared dish, 8 balls around the outside and 10 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> cm the centre.
Brush with melted butter. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Cover and prove again until well risen.

Place the dish onto the low or recommended rack. Cook on combination mode 200°C and (LOW) for 15-20 min until risen and golden brown. Leave in the dish for a few minutes before transferring to a wire cooling rack. Serve broken into rolls.

title: Sesame ball loaf - microwave
